dataIdInfo.idCredit: Created by the geneGIS team: Dori Dick, Shaun Walbridge, Scott Baker, Dawn Wright
dataIdInfo.idAbs: Use to this tool to select records from the dataset based on fields in the attribute table using up to three SQL statements.

tool.name: SelectDataByAttributes

param.name: Selection_Type
param.dialogReference: The default for this first SQL selection is NEW_SELECTION

param.name: SQL_Expression
param.dialogReference: Use the SQL Query Builder button to help build the SQL expression.

param.name: Selection_Type_2
param.dialogReference:
If a second selection is desired, use this second selection option to either:

ADD_TO_SELECTION - this selection will be added to the the records selected from the first selection

SUBSET_SELECTION - this selection with select from only those records selected in the first selection

param.name: SQL_Expression_2
param.dialogReference: Use the SQL Query Builder button to help build the SQL expression.

param.name: Selection_Type_3
param.dialogReference:
If a third selection is desired, use this third selection option to either:

ADD_TO_SELECTION - this selection will be added to the the records selected from the first and/or second selection

SUBSET_SELECTION - this selection with select from only those records selected in the first and/or second selection

param.name: SQL_Expression_3
param.dialogReference: Use the SQL Query Builder button to help build the SQL expression.

param.name: Output_Feature_Class_Location
param.dialogReference: The location where the new feature class will be placed.

param.name: Output_Feature_Class_Name
param.dialogReference: The name of the new feature class.

param.name: Log_File_Location
param.dialogReference: The location where a text log file will be placed when the tool is run. This log file can serve as a record of what feature class and SQL expressions were used.

tool.summary: Use to this tool to select records from the dataset based on fields in the attribute table using up to three SQL statements.
tool.usage:
Enables an input feature class to be filtered based on various fields within the attribute table.

NOTE: For help on Building Query Expressions check out the following ArcGIS webpages:

  • http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/main/10.1/index.html#/Building_a_query_expression/00s50000002t000000/

  • http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/main/10.1/index.html#/SQL_reference_for_query_expressions_used_in_ArcGIS/00s500000033000000/
